intro: Sinapis allionii, commonly known as Allion's mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring alternate, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its small, four-petaled flowers are characteristic of the mustard family, and it produces small, spherical pods containing several seeds. Sinapis allionii is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields.
